actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law

official_title: A bill to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act with respect to the admission of certain Amerasian children.

summary.text: Amerasian Immigration Amendments of 1987 - Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act regarding the preferential admissions of certain Amerasian persons to: (1) eliminate the birth cut-off date; (2) include Amerasians born in the Philippines, Japan, and Taiwan; (3) permit church or civil group sponsors; (4) reduce the sponsorship period from five years to two years; (5) permit the admission of mothers of minor children; and (6) permit the admission of certain pre-1950 cases from Korea.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act with respect to the admission of certain Amerasian children.
